justification: “Sensitivity is quantified in SDT by the measure d', which corresponds to the number of standard deviations that separate the means of the S1 and S2 distributions.”
“This measure allows us to estimate the metacognitive efficiency of an observer by comparing the meta-d' fitted to their type 2 ROC curves to their empirically measured d'.”

“It is not enough to have a graded evidence value x on a given trial; the observer must use x to make a definite decision… According to SDT, the observer accomplishes this by setting a decision criterion (denoted by the variable c₁).”
